reason: We are going to fix this up today hopefully and reissue from a different fork
description:
This adds an initial implementation of a smoothing kernel for pixelizing SPH fields directly onto a mesh.

This code is still in implementation stage, and is not yet exposed as a user-facing function.

Roadmap for this:

 * Implementation of smoothing function (eq 32 from SPLASH paper)
 * Tests
 * User-specified kernels
 * Pixelization exposed to user
title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw:
It's good to have this, but we'll need to allow for multiple weight functions.  Initially this doesn't need to happen, but ideally what we'll want is:

 * Accept a string naming the kernel
 * Call `get_kernel_func` from `yt/geometry/particle_deposit.pxd` and use that in the `weight_function`
 * Eventually, pre-computing this table a single time would be ideal
content.html:
It's good to have this, but we'll need to allow for multiple weight functions. Initially this doesn't need to happen, but ideally what we'll want is:

  • Accept a string naming the kernel
  • Call get_kernel_func from yt/geometry/particle_deposit.pxd and use that in the weight_function
  • Eventually, pre-computing this table a single time would be ideal

One possible speedup which should eventually be enabled is to apply these decorators:

@cython.boundscheck(False)
@cython.wraparound(False)

but that should come after it's fully tested.

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw: One possible speedup would be to precompute `idx = 1.0/dx` and `idy = 1.0/dy` and then, wherever you divide by `dx` or `dy`, multiply by `idx` or `idy`.
content.html: One possible speedup would be to precompute idx = 1.0/dx and idy = 1.0/dy and then, wherever you divide by dx or dy, multiply by idx or idy.

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw:
I had a hard time figuring out the way this loop operates.  I *think* it might be cleaner to iterate from the left pixel to the right.  What you're doing here is correct, but I would prefer to see the bounds be set in absolute pixel space.  So this would be something like:

`for xi in range( <int> ((posx[j] - hsml[j])*idx), <int> ((posx[j] + hsml[j])*idx))`

and then you could use `xi` and `yi` to directly index the `buff` variable.  You'd have to change the `x` to be just `bounds[0,0] + xi*dx`, for instance.
content.html:
I had a hard time figuring out the way this loop operates. I think it might be cleaner to iterate from the left pixel to the right. What you're doing here is correct, but I would prefer to see the bounds be set in absolute pixel space. So this would be something like:

for xi in range( <int> ((posx[j] - hsml[j])*idx), <int> ((posx[j] + hsml[j])*idx))

and then you could use xi and yi to directly index the buff variable. You'd have to change the x to be just bounds[0,0] + xi*dx, for instance.

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw: I'm not sure that the `fmax` here is right.  I think it should be with respect to `dx`, not `1/(2.*buff.shape[0])`.
content.html: I'm not sure that the fmax here is right. I think it should be with respect to dx, not 1/(2.*buff.shape[0]).

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw:
I think this could be done as:

```
for xi in range(<int> ( (posx[j] - hsml[j] - bounds[0,0]) * idx ), <int> ( (posx[j] + hsml[j] - bounds[0,0]) * idx) ):
```
content.html:
I think this could be done as:

for xi in range(<int> ( (posx[j] - hsml[j] - bounds[0,0]) * idx ), <int> ( (posx[j] + hsml[j] - bounds[0,0]) * idx) ):

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw: `x = xi * dx + bounds[0,0]`
content.html: x = xi * dx + bounds[0,0]

pullrequest.title: Initial addition of sph smoothing kernel.

content.raw: This PR implements a new feature, SPH smoothing onto a 2D grid, which I would really like to see get merged in before the feature freeze if possible.  It's not a WIP anymore in the sense that the functionality is there, but testing is still underway; if we could have this reviewed, during the freeze (or just after) we can then extend it with correctness tests and exposing via top-level wrappers.  (Well, the latter might constitute a new feature, so perhaps we could extend it with a docstring so that it could at least be used.)
content.html: This PR implements a new feature, SPH smoothing onto a 2D grid, which I would really like to see get merged in before the feature freeze if possible. It's not a WIP anymore in the sense that the functionality is there, but testing is still underway; if we could have this reviewed, during the freeze (or just after) we can then extend it with correctness tests and exposing via top-level wrappers. (Well, the latter might constitute a new feature, so perhaps we could extend it with a docstring so that it could at least be used.)
